free_text.Learning outcomes: The student will learn the role and the basic principles of an operating system, and the way it works.
free_text.Content: Introduction to operating systems[br/]Functions of an operating system.[br/]Historical evolution and terminology: spooling, multiprogramming, batch,[br/]time-sharing, real-time. Micro-kernels.[br/][br/]Resource management[br/]Processor management.[br/]Main memory management: contiguous storage allocation, paging (virtual[br/]memory).[br/]Virtual machine.[br/]Information management[br/]File systems, logical and physical organization.[br/]Mass-Storage Structure[br/]I/O Systems[br/]Information sharing and protection: access matrix, limitation of 1 dimensional addressing mechanisms, segmentation, capability.[br/]Distributed File Systems[br/][br/][br/]
free_text.Type of teaching: Ex cathedra. Exercises on the computer
free_text.Form of examination: Continuous, with final written exam.[br/]Midterm exam 30%, final exam 30%, homeworks 40%[br/]
